info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Berkshire County through 500 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Housatonic, or near Great Barrington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Great Barrington, Lee, Lenox, Becket, Otis, Sandisfield, Housatonic, Stockbridge, Richmond, West Stockbridge, Monterey, Washington, Alford, Tyringham, Hartsville, Montville, Glendale, Williamsville, Lenox Dale and The Center At Lenox. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...and east central New York.
